About UMass Amherst

UMass Amherst, the Commonwealth's flagship campus, is a nationally ranked public research university offering a full range of undergraduate, graduate and professional degrees. The University sits on nearly 1,450-acres in the scenic Pioneer Valley of Western Massachusetts, and offers a rich cultural environment in a bucolic setting close to major urban centers. In addition, the University is part of the Five Colleges (including Amherst College, Hampshire College, Mount Holyoke College, and Smith College), which adds to the intellectual energy of the region.




Job Summary

The Organizational Metrics Data Analyst is responsible for cultivating and communicating insights from data to facilitate decision-making, support program planning, advance marketing initiatives, and contribute to the rankings of Isenberg School of Management (ISOM).




Essential Functions

Designs, creates, and implements insightful data dashboards, databases and other reporting tools to support key strategic initiatives and ad-hoc requests for monitoring of admissions standards, enrollments, classroom utilization, student retention, student completion-rates, and faculty utilization.
Assists with data retrieval and submissions for external rankings of undergraduate and graduate programs.
Collaborates to devise, implement, and improve processes for data gathering and distribution across multiple departments and various channels.
Works with key stakeholders across ISOM and the University to coordinate and respond to information requests. Ensures effective communication and proper documentation of data sources, standards, and related processes and policies.
Translates success metrics into tracking and reporting requirements. Makes actionable recommendations to business decisionmakers based on research and analytical results.
Facilitates self-service reporting and data trainings for internal users and community members.
Produces reports such as email marketing reports, student success reports and enrollment management reports.
Supports survey assessment design, distribution, and management.



Other Functions

Performs related duties as assigned or required to meet department, school, and university goals and objectives.



Minimum Qualifications (Knowledge, Skills, Abilities, Education, Experience, Certifications, Licensure)

Bachelor’s degree and one (1) year of experience in business analytics.
Analytically minded with an aptitude for numbers and visualization of data.
Ability to analyze data to support management decisions and improve performance.
Ability to make data digestible to non-technical individuals or teams.
Excellent accuracy and attention to detail.
Experience with data visualization and dashboard tools such as Tableau.
Independent initiative.
Ability to establish priorities and manage multiple complex projects.
Ability to work well on cross-functional teams.
Strong skills in all Microsoft Office programs, especially Excel. Ability to learn new technical skills rapidly and independently.
Ability to establish and maintain productive relationships with ISOM community members.
Strong commitment to customer service.



Preferred Qualifications (Knowledge, Skills, Abilities, Education, Experience, Certifications, Licensure)

Experience with customer relationship management (CRM) systems, specifically Salesforce.
Experience in higher education or institutional research.
Programming experience using statistical tools (e.g., KNIME, SAS, R, SPSS).



Physical Demands/Working Conditions

Typical office environment.



Work Schedule

Monday - Friday, 37.5 hours week.
May require occasional travel for meetings and professional development opportunities.
This position has the opportunity for a hybrid work schedule, which is defined by the University as an arrangement where an employee’s work is regularly performed at a location other than the campus workspace for a portion of the week. As this position falls within the Professional Staff Union, it is subject to the terms and conditions of the Professional Staff Union collective bargaining agreement.

Job Title: Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion Data Analyst
Job Description:
Job Description:
The DEI Data Analyst supports the Office of the Senior Vice President for Community, Campus Culture, and Climate in driving positive change through data-driven insights, helping advance critical institutional priorities related to building community and fostering a campus culture and climate of diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging. This role requires experience with data collection, data visualization, and data-driven decision-making. This position also requires the ability to collect, analyze and translate complex data into meaningful narratives, as well as a strong interest in diversity, equity and inclusion (DEI). The DEI Data Analyst holds a pivotal role in tracking DEI-related key performance indicators throughout the organization and assisting in communicating them to the community to cultivate a culture of trust, transparency and continuous improvement. Additionally, this professional works closely with the Office of Institutional Research and Assessment in surveys, assessments, and cross-functional projects.
Collect and compile data from Maxient, Get Inclusive, and other platforms within the division of Community, Campus Climate and Culture (4C), and partner departments to keep the 4C dashboard updated.
Support the Senior Advisor/Senior Project Manager and Senior Vice President in gathering information for presentations, reports, and other documents.
Oversee the division’s training platforms, Vector and Get Inclusive, which includes being the point of contact with platform client representatives, working with IT and other departments to timely distribute online courses, and managing student and employee completion of training courses to ensure compliance by sending reminder emails and placing/removing account holds.
Assist in developing and coordinating assessments and surveys (e.g., campus climate) in close collaboration with Institutional Research and Assessment, analyzing and communicating results and compiling the data for reports.
Apply basic statistical concepts and descriptive statistics to understand and describe relationships in data.
Engage with diverse audiences regarding data and analytics, and clearly articulating complex terms and concepts.
Assist in the enhancement of 4C practices, guidelines, materials, and training programs based on data gathered through surveys, assessments, and other ways.
Gather and analyze data related to 4C, as well as diversity, equity, inclusion and belonging from units across Berklee for a range of projects and reports.
Participate in institutional assessments and data management committees related to activities such as student data management, accreditation, and institutional advancement.
Works with Senior Advisor/Senior Project manager in researching historical data within the organization.

Required Knowledge, Skills and Abilities
2-5 years of experience in data analytics
Ability to communicate clearly and concisely, both orally and in writing
Ability to balance multiple priorities and meet deadlines
Experience with data collection, visualization, and/or data-driven decision-making
Understanding of Google-based business tools
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Ability to explain complex problems and follow through to solution
Ability to understand and interpret regulations and guidelines
Experience in cross-functional project management
Interest in Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion topics

JLL supports the Whole You, personally and professionally.

Our people at JLL are shaping the future of real estate for a better world by combining world class services, advisory and technology to our clients. We are committed to hiring the best, most talented people in our industry; and we support them through professional growth, flexibility, and personalized benefits to manage life in and outside of work. Whether you’ve got deep experience in commercial real estate, skilled trades, and technology, or you’re looking to apply your relevant experience to a new industry, we empower you to shape a brighter way forward so you can thrive professionally and personally.

This position reports to the Product Support BAU Lead. In addition to the BAU activities, the analyst will support the deployments of Property products managed by other teams.
The Data Governance Analyst –Product Support will contribute to data governance and guidance for data migration and product deployment personnel. This person will work closely with the data governance leaders assigned to various regions, business lines and markets to understand product features, best practices and JLL data standards and policies.,
Specifically, this position will
Provide a single point of contact for data governance analyst activities relating to Property BAU support and Data Help Desk tickets .
Maintain account playbooks that document system processes and standards.
Work with Account, Data Governance and Data Management leads to ensure that data quality metric standards are met and adhered to after account go-live (Transitions) and on an on-going basis (Data Help Desk tickets).
Provide input to existing and new data standards.
Work closely with on-account teams to gather all data needs, including mastered data, while adhering to data standards.
Must handle multiple tasks, manage time effectively, and establish priorities to meet deadlines in a fast-paced and changing team environment
Perform additional job duties and support special projects as assigned, which will include but not be limited to data remediation issues.
Provide clear, up-to-date status on all work items
Be responsible for issue resolution of supported systems during daily operations.
Be responsible for oversight of data integration, data flows and downstream impact, primarily as they relate to BAU and potential impact to the account.
Follow all procedures and best practices when integrating data between systems and maintain weekly reviews and remediation.
Process property records ons, offs and decommissioning of Property Hub portals when needed.
Work with data governance peers to adhere to compliance policies and procedures.
Participate in product testing for any requested enhancements to ensure a quality solution.
Provide training/ education for product users to properly govern the data for quality and protection.
Capture and transfer user requests for system and process enhancements related to data standards and quality.
Assist in documentation of business processes and standard operations in support of the BAU data governance and stewardship operations for deployed products.

Required Qualifications & Experience Bachelor's degree in business administration, Information Management, MIS, Library Science, Computer Science or related fields; advanced degree preferred
1+ years of master data management related experience in an enterprise environment across multiple application systems or business functions
1 + years related experience in commercial real estate management (preferred) or related industry
Experience in dealing with internal and external customers, service providers and vendors. Must be able to manage competing priorities.
Hands-on experience with business analyst related activities or data profiling is preferred.
Detail oriented
Ability to multi-task and work both in a team and independently
Ability to effectively work and communicate across organizational lines.
Needs to be resilient; resolving conflicts quickly to achieve desired business results.
Demonstration high level of skills in Excel, Word and PowerPoint required.
Exposure to SQL and MS Visio

Skills
Excellent oral, written, and presentation communication skills
Analytical and creative problem-solving skills. Apply listening and consultative skills to understand business needs; be able to interpret requirements, identify impacts and analyze problems to determine impacts to business processes across the organization.
Ability to manage, manipulate and analyze raw data, draw conclusions, and develop actionable recommendations using technology. Articulate the issues and resolutions via business-friendly communications.
Ability to understand and produce user-based documentation for complex data and analytical products.
Ability to work well under deadlines and make good judgments about competing priorities.
Good understanding of data quality management. Knowledge of data governance and how it impacts business processes.
Knowledge of data management in a global environment, including data lifecycle and maintenance processes.

Personalized benefits that support personal well-being and growth:

About JLL –

We’re JLL—a leading professional services and investment management firm specializing in real estate. We have operations in over 80 countries and a workforce of over 102,000 individuals around the world who help real estate owners, occupiers and investors achieve their business ambitions. As a global Fortune 500 company, we also have an inherent responsibility to drive sustainability and corporate social responsibility. That’s why we’re committed to our purpose to shape the future of real estate for a better world. We’re using the most advanced technology to create rewarding opportunities, amazing spaces and sustainable real estate solutions for our clients, our people, and our communities.

Our core values of teamwork, ethics and excellence are also fundamental to everything we do and we’re honored to be recognized with awards for our success by organizations both globally and locally.

Creating a diverse and inclusive culture where we all feel welcomed, valued and empowered to achieve our full potential is important to who we are today and where we’re headed in the future. And we know that unique backgrounds, experiences and perspectives help us think bigger, spark innovation and succeed together.

Wayfair is seeking analytical, entrepreneurial, and action-oriented candidates for Business Analyst opportunities. Analysts will play a critical role in Wayfair’s growth strategy and competitive positioning by leveraging data-driven analyses and innovative approaches to drive results for internal and external business partners. Successful Analysts are quantitatively-oriented, endlessly curious, and thrive in fast-paced and collaborative environments. This is an ideal opportunity for candidates who are interested in entering the technology and e-commerce space, developing hands-on analytical and technical skills, and working closely with core business functions to drive real impact and results.

Wayfair places Business Analysts into several core business functions. Function placement is determined through the application and interview process and is dependent on a combination of interest, skills, and experience. When applying, please indicate your top two choices for functional areas of interest. If we notice a stronger alignment for a team other than those indicated in the application, we will also consider you for that opportunity.

Functional areas and potential team placements include:
Profit Management, Competitive Intelligence & Business Trends

The Profit Management, Competitive Intelligence & Business Trends teams are focused on steering growth strategy, optimization of Wayfair’s competitive positioning and billion-dollar P&L management across Wayfair’s product verticals, by leveraging highly quantitative business analytics. This tight-knit, entrepreneurial team has a big appetite for bold ideas, a strong bias for action, and provides a distinct opportunity to drive decisions that have significant impact across every major business function at the company. Analysts directly control Wayfair’s dynamic pricing and product sorting capabilities to manage the delicate tradeoff between short and long term profitability, while working cross-functionally to affect product selection, merchandising, operations, and marketing initiatives. Analysts play a key role in building cutting edge ‘Big Data’ and leveraging these unique, proprietary, and massive datasets, coupled with a constant flow of experimentation on consumer response, to answer thorny questions that guide our go-to-market strategy.

Marketing Strategy & Analytics

Our Marketing team drives growth for Wayfair on every major advertising platform. We aren’t your standard marketers: we own the strategy, P&L, and roadmaps for our portfolio of cutting-edge and in-house-built marketing and AdTech products. We utilize data to acquire high-potential customers and engage them to come back again and again. We drive profitable top line revenue by investing marketing dollars where they will provide the greatest return for the business and leverage our understanding of the customer to impact the overall business strategy. As an Analyst, you will own a specific channel (e.g. Search, Display, Email, Social Media, TV/Online Video, etc.) end-to-end. You’ll be tasked with managing a multi-million dollar budget, helping to drive ad tech development, and devising new testing strategies to grow the business.

Talent Analytics and Compensation

Wayfair believes that our people are our greatest asset and biggest differentiator - and these teams focus on actualizing that potential through data and analytics. As a team member, you will work closely with Wayfair’s senior leadership to influence compensation strategy and improve the candidate and employee experience. You will test hypotheses, build and improve models, present to business leaders, upgrade data systems, and conduct market analyses aimed at optimizing the employee experience at Wayfair.

Operations

Wayfair’s Operations organization is revolutionizing the customer experience through the development of a proprietary logistics network and optimization platform that manages inventory from overseas factories to customer’s front door. This team works directly with suppliers, vendors, and customers to provide new levels of efficiency and performance. They also interact internally with Product, Engineering and Business Intelligence teams to generate the core analytical insights that enable Wayfair to tackle transportation, warehousing, and delivery challenges. As an Analyst, you’ll develop and execute strategies that generate competitive advantage for Wayfair, and the results of your findings will improve the day-to-day efficiency of a complex and sophisticated global supply chain.

What You’ll Need:

Strong consultative skills: ability to work effectively and persuasively with a highly cross- functional group of business partners
Strong business acumen: ability to understand how various parts of the business interact; can identify and approach problems from a customer or supplier perspective
Exceptional analytical and quantitative skills: excited about working with and synthesizing big data into actionable insights; comfortable using data software to conduct analyses and synthesize findings
Exceptional problem-solving and execution skills: ability to make decisions, reprioritize tasks, and draw conclusions in the face of ambiguity
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Proficient with Microsoft Excel
Familiarity with any programming language is a plus, including motivation to learn and develop the skill-set (Google BigQuery/SQL, R, Python)
Bachelor's degree earned by Winter 2023 or Summer 2024
An Important Note about Wayfair's In-Office Policy:
All Boston-based interns, Co-ops, and corporate employees will be in office in a hybrid capacity. Employees will work in the office on designated days, Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, and Thursday, and work remotely the other 1 day of the week.

At this time, Wayfair does not provide sponsorship for employment authorization for this position.

Assistance for Individuals with Disabilities

Wayfair is fully committed to providing equal opportunities for all individuals, including individuals with disabilities. Work closely with Clinical, Medical Affairs, and Regulatory affairs groups to understand the business needs and document the current business process and the future state.
Work closely with business and author user requirement specification (URS).
Build internal IT SOPs for the system owned by the Clinical systems.

Responsibilities

Development of user requirement specifications and associated use cases.
Definition of process maps and optimized approaches to fulfil user requirements.
Traceability mapping and other analysis documentation as required.
Analyze clinical processes, data flows, and data needs to identify solution opportunities, enhancements, data mapping and integration needs.
Work closely with product owners, development teams, and users to interpret solution demand, refine user requirements/stories, and prioritize backlog tasks.
Work closely with project leads and other key stakeholders to Identify and manage risks and issues associated with collected demands, report on progress and outcomes.
Participate in required meetings to communicate status and outcomes.
Ensure compliance with industry processes and regulations.
Draft User acceptance test scripts (UAT), review, and dry run with the business team.

Requirements:

Minimum of 5 years of experience as a business analyst or similar type role in Pharmaceutical Industry.
Bachelor’s or master’s degree in computer science, information systems, business, healthcare, or a related field.
Strong understanding of R&D clinical processes and data, knowledgeable of data management practices. Familiar with industry regulations and best practices.
Good Understanding of GxP processes
Excellent analytical skills and proven ability to collaborate cross-functionally with stakeholders to capture value driven requirements and translate to solution outcomes.
Familiar with agile project management and data management processes, experienced in data platforms and landscapes.
Experience leading requirements gathering, analysis, and documentation.
Strong skills in user requirements elicitation and process definition for application in technology solutions.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Knowledgeable of industry standards and best practices, with a problem-solving mindset.
Ability to work well on concurrent multidisciplinary projects.
Experience working in a fast paced rapidly growing company.
Experience with pharma applications including Veeva RIM, Veeva Medcomms & Promomats is a plus.

Senior Business Intelligence Analyst, National Medical Care, Inc., a Fresenius Medical Care N.A. company, Waltham, Massachusetts (Remote)


Purpose and Scope:


Responsible for providing support with ongoing systems development and business intelligence activities with respect to diverse financial system projects.


Principal Duties and Responsibilities:


Utilizing knowledge and expertise of solutions design and implementation to support divisional efforts to enhance Business Intelligence (BI) systems and processes by monitoring performance and migrating data from outside systems.

Interfacing with business leaders and end-users from corporate departments and business areas to scope, design, implement and manage the project to deliver BI solutions to the business.

Building the business intelligence layer to deliver reporting and analytical tools to finance and business management.

Detailing the business requirements gathering process, requirements definition, and approval.

Formulating highly detailed BI solutions which can be practically implemented.

Creating, managing, and documenting detailed project plans used to drive successful project completion.

Identifying and implementing solutions to enhance the existing BI infrastructure processes and technology.

Creating documentation to assist SAP BW developers and business users in designing and effectively/efficiently utilizing the solutions developed.

Creating and delivering training to corporate and division users on all BI applications, including Business Objects, BW, IP and BEx tools.

Maintaining appropriate documentation of verification of resolved queries as regulated per Sarbanes Oxley requirements to be transported into the BI production environment.

Serving as a liaison between the Financial and Corporate Information Systems divisions to manage the coordination of the configuration, the development of business processes, enhancements and the stabilization of the SAP BI environment.

Executing on all phases of implementation, including planning, development, training, deployment, post-implementation support, and enhancements as it relates to SAP BI and business users.

Researching and determining best business practices to meet the goals and objectives of the business utilizing available operational and financial systems and company resources.

Coordinating and verifying the updating of Navigation Attributes as they relate to Profit Centers in SAP BI environment using financial center personnel and available company resources.

Coordinating with the SAP Basis team and Finance & Operations personnel regarding the assignment of data authorizations and SAP BI roles.

Creating and maintaining global variables, variants and structures for use in query design for end users.


Education Experience and Required Skills:


Position requires either (i) a Bachelor’s degree (or an equivalent foreign degree) in Information Technology, Information Systems or Finance and 5 years of experience as a systems analyst for enterprise-level systems or (ii) a Master’s degree (or an equivalent foreign degree) in Information Technology, Information Systems or Finance and 2 years of experience as a systems analyst for enterprise-level systems. Must also have 2 years of experience (which can have been gained concurrently with either primary experience requirement above) working with the following:

Requirements definition, data acquisition processes, data modeling, process automation, construction and deployment;

Business Objects suite and SAP BEx and the Eclipse modeling tool;

SAP HANA;

SAP Analytics Cloud; and

Anaplan Planning Tool.


This is a telecommuting position working from home. May reside anywhere in the United States.

Job Summary: Under the direction of the Director of Advanced Analytics, the Senior Healthcare Data Analyst will join a centralized analytics team grounded in data science that includes leadership and staff from across BIDMC to participate in projects that promote a culture of excellence. The Senior Healthcare Data Analyst possesses intellectual curiosity and the ability to manage multiple complex data projects simultaneously. Serves as primary point of contact for requests for business unit. Leverages software applications to design solutions, performs detailed data mapping and analysis, and reviews all data for insights prior to distribution.


Job Description:

Essential Responsibilities:

In collaboration with Director, works as a strategic business partner with members of senior leadership and teams to produce data that assists in key decision making, quality improvement and enhanced patient outcomes.
Manages one or more complex data projects. Utilizes hospital systems and databases to update and analyze data. Maintains integrity and quality of data by understanding workflows.
Draws upon advanced technical skills, including programming and/ or query skills and business intelligence tools.
Translates business needs and requirements into technical specifications.
Designs, implements, and support data modeling and data warehouse enhancement project. Creates reports and dashboards that track multidimensional performance against division or department goals
Expertise in data visualization, with ability to display key results including use of control charts, failure rates, trend graphs is essential.
Responsible for routine and ad hoc dissemination of key information to stakeholders.
Evaluates utility of reporting methods and visual representations frequently in order to effectively communication through data.
Ability to convey insights from business intelligence projects and guides others during the design process.
Prepares documentation of analytic methods, metric development, and report production processes.
Required Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Allied Health or related required. Master's degree in Public Health, Epidemiology, Biostatistics or equivalent preferred.
5-8 years related work experience required.
Strong experience in data management and advanced analytic tools and techniques; Strong experience in report writing, analytics, visualizations, dashboard creation, and mobile BI development; Strong experience demonstrating analytical, financial, qualitative and quantitative skills.
Advanced technical computer skills as required for technical support specific to functional area and related systems.
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience with predictive modeling and/or Machine Learning technologies. Working knowledge of programming and query language (e.g. SQL, Python, R).
Experience with business intelligence tools for data visualization and report automation.
Understanding of data management and manipulation and interpretation of large databases in a medical center environment.
Competencies:
Decision Making: Ability to make decisions that are guided by precedents, policies and objectives. Regularly makes decisions and recommendations on issues affecting a department or functional area.
Problem Solving: Ability to address problems that are highly varied, complex and often non-recurring, requiring staff input, innovative, creative, and Lean diagnostic techniques to resolve issues.
Independence of Action: Ability to set goals and determines how to accomplish defined results with some guidelines. Manager/Director provides broad guidance and overall direction.
Written Communications: Ability to communicate clearly and effectively in written English with internal and external customers.
Oral Communications: Ability to comprehend and converse in English to communicate effectively with medical center staff, patients, families and external customers.
Knowledge: Ability to demonstrate in-depth knowledge of concepts, practices and policies with the ability to use them in complex varied situations.
Team Work: Ability to act as a team leader for small projects or work groups, creating a collaborative and respectful team environment and improving workflows. Results may impact the operations of one or more departments.
Customer Service: Ability to provide a high level of customer service to patients, visitors, staff and external customers in a professional, service-oriented, respectful manner using skills in active listening and problem solving. Ability to remain calm in stressful situations.

Physical Nature of the Job:
Sedentary work: Exerting up to 10 pounds of force occasionally in carrying, lifting, pushing, pulling objects. Sitting most of the time, with walking and standing required only occasionally

FLSA Status:

Exempt

An education technology company in Massachusetts is looking to add a new Senior ERP Business Analyst to their team in Middlesex County. In this role, the Senior ERP Business Analyst will be responsible for functioning as a strategic contributor for financial processes leveraging Workday technologies across the enterprise as well as providing oversight in all financial applications initiatives.

Responsibilities:

The Senior ERP Business Analyst will:
Serve as a strategic partner for Workday Financials as the IT point of contact for business leaders and stakeholders
Demonstrate expertise and ownership for the configuration and testing of the Workday platform
Serve as the IT’s primary contact and coordinator for financial systems upgrades/enhancements
Coordinate and run user testing and manage the launch of business processes
Proactively prepare for annual activities and bi-annual releases supported by the Workday system
Collaborate with functional business owners and subject matter experts (SMEs) to gather high level and detailed requirements for Financials Management
Development and maintenance of technical system documentation surrounding all financial processes and related interfaces that impact the financial accounting and reporting systems
Responsible for business process configurations, testing, and deployment while ensuring data integrity
Serve as a primary lead in all Finance/ERP current and future initiatives
Qualifications:
3+ years of experience participating in ERP deployments
Strong experience in supporting and driving ERP projects in financial modules such as Accounts Payable, FP&A, Revenue, Procurement etc.
Strong working knowledge of finance modules of the Workday ERP
Participation and experience in full life cycle ERP Financial implementations
Experience gathering and aligning business requirements across stakeholders that span job levels and functions
Strong experience writing requirements, test scripts, and guiding/leading testing projects in an ERP
Solid problem solving and time management skills
Great interpersonal skills
Excellent communication skills (written and verbal)
Strong attention to detail
Highly organized

Job Description
Cognex stands as the foremost global leader in industrial machine vision, boasting unparalleled success and recognition. Our cutting-edge vision and ID systems leverage advanced optics, image sensors, and artificial intelligence software to capture and analyze images, enabling us to decipher the world around us. We are deeply committed to fostering an inclusive and equitable work environment, guided by our "Work Hard, Play Hard, Move Fast" culture, which celebrates employee innovation, determination, and dedication in a dynamic, fun, and distinctive atmosphere.
As a Marketing Data Analyst (MDA) at Cognex, you'll engage with various aspects of our business, including Marketing, Sales Development, Sales Operation, and Outside Sales. Your role as an MDA involves collaborating cross-functionally with Marketing executives and other leaders to pinpoint improvement opportunities. You'll craft reports for internal teams, work closely with colleagues to gather and analyze data, employ graphical representations, and other visualization methods, establish Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) to gauge the effectiveness of business decisions, and structure extensive data sets to extract actionable insights.
Key Responsibilities:
Apply analytical, statistical, and programming skills to collect, analyze, and interpret extensive datasets, unearthing patterns and trends that yield valuable insights.
Actively identify trends, opportunities, patterns, anomalies, spikes, and other data occurrences, enhancing marketing efficiency.
Synthesize data from diverse sources and deliver actionable insights rooted in both qualitative and quantitative inputs.
Initiate and provide analytical services and insights to our marketing team by regularly updating and presenting weekly and monthly reports, scorecards, dashboards, and key performance reports.
Contribute feedback to marketing effectiveness and efficiency initiatives while effectively communicating recommendations.
Ensure data accuracy by verifying, cleaning, manipulating, and merging data before reporting and analysis.
Oversee the lead capture process within the marketing automation system to ensure comprehensive activity data capture.
Collaborate with the marketing department to assess, define, and develop report deliverables tailored to their needs.
Foster interdepartmental relationships and channels of communication.
Education and Experience:
A minimum of 5 years of relevant experience, showcasing a proven track record of utilizing data analytics to drive significant business impact.
Bachelor's degree in engineering, web/analytics management/development experience, or equivalent work background.
Demonstrates a results-driven, proactive mindset, driven to meet objectives swiftly.
Exhibits a high degree of self-discipline, conscientiousness, sound judgment, and attention to detail, aligning with responsibilities.
Strong planning, organizational, time management, and follow-through capabilities.
Technologically adept, as evidenced by advanced Microsoft Office skills and rapid adaptation to new applications and software.
Proven ability to grasp business objectives and deliver results.
Comprehensive understanding of customer relationship management and associated practices, strategies, and technologies.
Proficiency in SalesForce and Power BI, with a comfort level navigating these tools.

Additional Job Description
Equal Employment Opportunity
Cognex is an equal opportunity employer. Cognex evaluates qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, protected veteran status, disability/handicap status or any other legally protected characteristic.

Position Summary:

Catalent Pharma Solutions is Chelsea, MA is hiring a Quality Control Analyst III who is responsible for executing QC testing and related analytical activities supporting product development, release and stability. This individual conducts routine and non-routine chemical and physical analyses of raw materials, in-process materials and drug products according to standard operating procedures. The Quality Control Analyst compiles data for documentation of test procedures that may include stability program testing and formulation studies, participates in the preparation of investigations, summaries and reports, and reviews data obtained for compliance to specifications and reports out-of-trend and/or out-of-specification results.

This is a full-time role position: Monday – Friday, days.

Catalent is a global, high-growth, public company and a leading partner for the pharmaceutical industry in the development and manufacturing of new treatments for patients worldwide. Your talents, ideas, and passion are essential to our mission: to help people live better, healthier lives.

This 90,000 square-foot Boston-area facility is Catalent’s global Center of Excellence for spray dry dispersion and Dry Powder Inhaler (DPI) capsule manufacture and packaging. The site features inhaled powder spray drying, as well as multiple commercial-scale lines for capsule filling and blister packaging. On-site spray dryers include best-in-class GEA Niro SD1, SD4 and SD7, the latter being the largest CGMP unit of its kind for DPI in North America.

Catalent is committed to a Patient First culture through excellence in quality and compliance, and to the safety of every patient, consumer, and Catalent employee.

The Role

Operates analytical instrumentation (i.e. HPLC, UPLC, GC, UV-vis, FTIR, laser diffraction, KF).
Statistically and critically analyzes data for trending and reporting into regulatory filings.
Participates in Laboratory and/or Quality Investigations.
Monitors equipment and instrumentation used on a daily basis to ensure proper operation and calibration.
Participates in the construction and/or revision of SOPs.
Assists in the writing and updating of analytical test procedures, protocol, log books and checklists.
Responsible for identifying and alerting a supervisor of issues on instruments and/or test executions; makes initial recommendations for possible solutions and/or corrective actions.
All other duties as assigned;

The Candidate

Bachelor’s Degree in Physical or Chemical Sciences (life sciences) required.
Minimum of 5-7 years of experience in a cGMP regulated environment required.
Experience in MDI/DPI analytical test methods (i.e. Andersen Cascade Impactor and Emitted Dose techniques) preferred.
Individual may be required to sit, stand, walk regularly and occasionally lift 0-15 pounds;

Why you should join Catalent:

Defined career path and annual performance review and feedback process
Diverse, inclusive culture
19 days of PTO + 8 paid holidays
Several Employee Resource Groups focusing on D&I
Dynamic, fast-paced work environment
Employee Stock Purchase Program
Positive working environment focusing on continually improving processes to remain innovative
Potential for career growth on an expanding team within an organization dedicated to preserving and bettering lives
Competitive salary with bonus potential
Community engagement and green initiatives
Generous 401K match and Paid Time Off accrual
Medical, dental and vision benefits effective day one of employment
Tuition Reimbursement – Let us help you finish your degree or earn a new one!
GymPass program to promote overall physical wellness
Perkspot - offers exclusive or private discounts from approximately 900+ merchants in a wide array of categories

Catalent offers rewarding opportunities to further your career! Join the global drug development and delivery leader and help us bring over 7,000 life-saving and life-enhancing products to patients around the world. Catalent is an exciting and growing international company where employees work directly with pharma, biopharma and consumer health companies of all sizes to advance new medicines from early development to clinical trials and to the market. Catalent produces more than 70 billion doses per year, and each one will be used by someone who is counting on us. Join us in making a difference.

Catalent is committed to the health and safety of its employees, visitors and the customers and patients we serve. As a result of the global pandemic, we have modified many of our recruitment and on-boarding processes to maintain everyone’s safety. The Human Resources teams will communicate all necessary safety processes and procedures throughout each stage.

Job Description:

Overview

We are looking for someone to come on board at Sun Life to help drive our API digital experience solution. This role will focus on Implementation and Production Support for APIs in our Digital Services organization.

Digital connections are in demand and changes are happening all the time. Sun Life wants to deliver solutions quickly and accurately for our Group clients.

We’re looking for someone who embraces technology and has prior experience with APIs. Do you have experience with operationalizing the implementation process as well as ongoing production support processes of APIs? Are you an experienced Business Analyst with a flair for documentation and process?

We work in a fast-paced Agile digital growth environment and our team is ready to add a dedicated API process enablement guru. In your job as a Business Analyst (API), you will build, and continuously improve, our API solution documentation and process framework. Come join our collaborative and supportive team!

Responsibilities

The Business Analyst, API Process Enablement will act as the central focal point to gather and document requirements for API implementation and ongoing production support. This person will work closely with collaborators across the organization to understand current processes and how they will be impacted by the introduction of API technology within their respective areas. As a result, this role will strengthen documentation and evolve business process. As an API Business Analyst Process Owner you will play a critical role in overseeing the processes and strategies related to our API products. You will work closely with cross-functional teams, including developers, product managers, and business stakeholders, to ensure the successful planning, development, and delivery of APIs that meet our customers' needs.

Impact Analysis:

Perform process impact analysis. Document and communicate changes in business workflow that will change as we implement technology enhancements and/or new API connections.

Business Process Analysis:

Conduct interviews, workshops and analyze current documentation to maintain an accurate process with aligned documentation.

Review, design and implement processes and procedures to manage the asset to ensure that full lifecycle management is in place with all mandatory attributes populated for each endpoint, closing any gaps.

Technical Writing:

Review current API process to document changes, opportunities, and variations in workflow. Create and maintain detailed documentation, including data flow diagrams, and process maps, to ensure clarity and consistency.

Collaboration:

Collaborate with development teams and business owners to identify business needs and where IT deliverables and Business strategy execution meet. The ability to question, gather, assimilate, and document this information is critical to this role.

Collaborate with team members across Digital Services, for each digital connection type, to ensure there is standardization across each area for processes and data capture.

User Acceptance Testing:

Participate in user acceptance testing. Provide timely feedback to ensure a strong product is delivered for a good client experience.

Quality Assurance:

Collaborate with the QA team to define test plans, test cases, and test data for API testing. The BA ensures that the API functions correctly, handles errors appropriately, and performs optimally under different scenarios.

Change Management:

Assist in change management processes related to the API, including impact analysis, change requests, and version control. The BA helps manage changes to the API design, functionality, and deployment process, ensuring smooth transitions and minimal disruptions.

Post-Implementation Support:

Provide support during the post-implementation phase, addressing user queries, troubleshooting issues, and facilitating continuous improvement of the API based on user feedback.

Requirements to be successful in this role you will need to be:

Highly motivated and disciplined.
Communicate effectively both verbally and in writing.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Strong negotiation and decision-making skills.
Strong stakeholder management skills
Keen understanding of the details.
We are very much targeting candidates with business experience with APIs.
Documentation excellence is key.
Strong planning and organizational skills, with the ability to multi-task.
Solid working knowledge of MS Office Suite.
Solid working knowledge of Workday.
Solid Knowledge on JIRA Cloud.
Other factors that will get our attention:
Experience in working with Insurance company or related financial institution and understand its business processes.
Knowledge of API documentation methods
Knowledge of API protocols (e.g. REST)
We will provide the support, but we are looking for an independent self-starter with strong time management skills. We need you to meet objectives and deadlines without heavy supervision.
It’s a plus if you’ve previously worked in the SAFe/Agile Methodology.
You need to love to learn.
Do you like finding solutions? This person will need to be an excellent problem-solver with strong investigation skills and the ability to provide solutions.
Able to recognize when to apply traditional BA techniques and when to use ‘lite’ methodology to achieve the project objectives. Able to recognize when to apply traditional BA techniques and when to use ‘lite’ methodology to achieve the project objectives.

Do you see yourself in this role even if you haven’t checked all the boxes above? We welcome all talented candidates and are committed to a culture that represents diversity in all forms. If you think you might thrive in this setting, we would love to hear from you.

Not ready to apply yet but want to stay in touch? Join our talent community to stay connected until the time is right for you!

Job Title: Business Analyst, End User Behavior & Analytics Team Senior Analyst
Company Name: Blue Cross Blue Shield of Massachusetts
Job Description:
Ready to help us transform healthcare? Bring your true colors to blue.
The Business Analyst for the End User Behavior & Analytics Team will be the primary technical and operational point of contact for the full stack of core reporting, user training, simulations and metrics related to their activities. This BA will understand the nuances of how this service is being used to support the leadership decision making process as well as its technical capabilities, always striving to keep them aligned. This role continually looks to the business to help articulate the creative ways the information can be used to demonstrate the current state of our information security program effectiveness as it relates to the threat landscape and our environment. This person is also responsible for executing the strategic vision and for realizing the roadmap for implementing new features and functionality associated with this service.

Key Accountabilities:Responsibilities:

Experienced project manager and business analyst
Expertise in Information security governance and operating in a standard framework methodology.
Experience in working with specific EUBA and Learning Management Systems and tools as well as the metrics and proof of delivery.
Understands, develops, and delivers meaningful dashboards and reports to a wide audience demonstrating our current program state and adherence to framework standards.
Understand business needs and adjust or develop new processes to efficiently provide excellent service and value to the consumers of this information.
Use the information generated by our governance tools to assist in driving awareness and change to stakeholders.
Develop standard operating procedures and other appropriate documentation to enforce quality and consistency of the services this team provides.
Prepares, evaluates, and presents solutions and makes recommendations to stakeholders.
Audit Committee and Risk Committee project management and support, including timely development, review, approval, and delivery of Audit Committee materials.
Maintains integrity and quality of data by understanding workflows.
Draws upon advanced technical skills, including programming and/ or query skills and business intelligence tools.
Translates business needs and requirements into technical specifications.
Creates reports and dashboards that track multidimensional performance against division or department goals.
Expertise in data visualization, with ability to display key results including use of control charts, failure rates, trends, and graphs.
Responsible for routine and ad hoc dissemination of key information to stakeholders.
Evaluates utility of reporting methods and visual representations to communicate effectively through data.
Ability to convey insights and guides others during the design process.
Prepares documentation of SOPs, methods, metric development, and report production processes.
Key Competencies

Technically competent
o Understanding of information security frameworks, security operations / program management, standard IT processes and challenges.

Adaptability & Growth
o Adapts leadership work style to fit environment needs.
o Develops and demonstrates intimacy and understanding of the BCBSMA environment.
o Capable of working with others to follow through on cross-functional tasks.

Analyzing Needs & Proposing Solutions
o Owns problems and solutions as a creative problem solver.
o Considers the implications of the recommended solution considering the culture and context of BCBSMA.

Fostering Teamwork & Collaboration
o Seeks and develops suggestions from others, drives partnering relationships.
o Uses appropriate influencing techniques to gain genuine agreement.

About Agero:
Wherever drivers go, we're leading the way. As the #1 B2B, white-label provider of digital driver assistance services, we're pushing the industry in a new direction, taking manual processes, and redefining them as digital, transparent, and connected. Job Description:

The Sr Business Analyst is responsible for supporting business leadership across multiple product lines by developing and delivering data-driven insights. This role will need to intimately understand the nuance of their product lines (via both analysis of data and stakeholder interviews) and be able to distill the most meaningful insights for an executive audience. This role requires strong SQL capabilities, critical thinking, and business acumen. The ideal candidate will have experience not just working closely with data engineers and other analysts but also in interfacing with business leaders and operations teams to generate requirements and validate results. You will become the "go-to" person for insights generation in your supported product lines and be a crucial partner to business teams looking to better understand and improve their lines of business.

Key Outcomes:

Build and maintain a suite of dashboards that answer your stakeholder's most important questions in an easily digestible way
Develop a deep understanding of both your line of business and the underpinning data needed to measure and understand it
Build strong rapport with your stakeholders such that you become their "one-stop-shop" for understanding their piece of the business

Key Responsibilities:

Partner with business leaders to understand their needs and develop data products to answer their questions
Build and maintain SQL queries to analyze data and generate reports
Distill insights and communicate them effectively with the proper supporting documentation
Collaborate with data engineers and other data analysts to ensure that your data products are of high quality and meet the needs of business users.

Qualifications:

3+ years of experience in a similar analytical role.
Strong technical proficiency in SQL
Experience with data visualization / BI tools (we use Sigma)
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to interact with stakeholders across all levels of the organization
Motivated to understand the nuances of data and its impact on the business.
Demonstrated project management and financial aptitude. A creative problem-solver with a passion for producing quality deliverables.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Previous automotive related experience is a plus.

Success Metrics:

Business leadership trusts the data products that have been built to answer the question, "how is my product line performing?"
Data products are of high quality and meet the needs of business users.
Data presentations are clear, concise, and actionable.

United States: AZ, FL, NC, IL, KY, MA, MI, NM, TN, and VA
Canada: Province of Ontario

PURPOSE AND SCOPE:

The Principal Business Analyst develops, interprets and implements complex financial and/or accounting concepts for financial planning, conducts month/year end closings, and prepares/leads annual budget cycle for the designed group within FMCNA. The Principal Business Analyst performs economic research and studies in areas of business analysis within the assigned function(s).

PRINCIPAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

Utilize knowledge of accounting and/or financial principles by reviewing, reconciling and consolidating submitted financial data of complex scope on a routine basis; collaborating with cross-divisional teams on the accurate and timely resolution of outstanding issues.

Serve as a subject matter expert (SME) by providing in-depth analysis, review and presentation of diverse financial reports.
Conduct month/year close processes and reporting according to financial calendar and report results .
Performs advanced, highly complex analyses on a regular basis for prospective and ongoing business initiatives; analyses may include but are not limited to profit and loss statements, financial modeling, forecast/budget cycles and trend analysis
May participate in process reviews, business process analyses and internal control testing; ensuring compliance with Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP), Sarbanes-Oxley Act (SOX), and other regulatory requirements within the assigned function(s).
Responsible for driving the coordination, completion and leadership of special interdepartmental financial projects
May act as a mentor, providing functional guidance, support and advice to Financial Analysts in the department.
Initiate projects that contribute to the companies going concern while partnering with internal and external cross-functional customers to develop improved processes, methods, and company initiatives
Develop and lead leadership training to all staff on utilizing technical systems/ERS
Liaise with other cross departmental members of finance
Lead training to Operations on financial aspects of business
Performs other duties as assigned.

PHYSICAL DEMANDS AND WORKING CONDITIONS:

The physical demands and work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

SUPERVISION:

None

EDUCATION:

Bachelor’s Degree required; MBA desirable

EXPERIENCE AND REQUIRED SKILLS:

8+ years’ related experience; or a Master’s degree with 5 years’ experience
Excellent computer skill with strong demonstrated proficiency in word processing, spreadsheet, presentation and email applications. Macro development preferred
Previous financial experience in a Site Management Organization preferred
Working knowledge of enterprise resource planning (ERP) and financial systems (e.g., SAP, Anaplan, etc.). Working knowledge of BEx query designer highly preferred
Working knowledge of GAAP and SOX.
Proven track record within the organization for adding value and shows strong potential for leadership positions. Internal candidates preferred.
Detail oriented with strong analytical and organizational skills.
Experience in a fast-paced environment with changing priorities, tasks and client conditions.
Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to establish and maintain relationships through diplomacy and tact.
Able to work independently with minimal supervision and alternately within a team environment.
Strong oral and written communication skills to effectively communicate with all levels of management

ADDEMUM:

Serve as a subject matter expert (SME) by providing in-depth analysis, review and presentation of diverse revenue recognition data.
Provide support to product management team for budgeting & forecasting.
Lead Revenue recognition meetings with sales teams; spotlighting areas of concern and reporting/developing KPIs.
Work towards automation of process regarding input into SAP and enhancing Power BI reports.
Acts as central point of contact for order status and reporting within department.
Ensure all sales orders are entered into SAP accurately.
Responsible for maintaining department workflow guidelines, working with department to revise as needed and distribute within department. Conduct department training on revised workflow guidelines as needed.
Compares orders to sales Special Offer Letters and/or Contracts, determining any order discrepancies, and communicates same to sales and/or customer
Responds to customer and sales requests regarding equipment purchase order processes, order status, and delivery information, providing tracking and proofs of delivery as needed

Analyzes and resolves customer equipment order concerns and routine complaints using established procedures to ensure customer satisfaction and company profitability.
Maintains audit trail of documentation and creates billing reconciliation requests and follows up with A/R, as necessary.
Produces and distributes daily, weekly, and monthly reports to inform sales and senior management of current equipment orders, shipments, and sales status.

Position Description

We're looking for a Senior or Staff level Analyst to join our team with a culture rooted in kindness, empathy, and product-mindedness. This analyst will be focused on helping support the Engagement and Access team with marketing forecasting, operational analytics, and insight development. This role will be a member of the growing Analytics team but will work closely with the Chief Customer & Engagement Officer.

Some of the exciting projects that this role will get to work on include optimizing marketing spend based on performance and clinic capacity, developing insights based on "closed loop" marketing reporting to focus Engagement efforts on revenue-driving outcomes, and communicating data recommendations to key stakeholders on the marketing team.

We use a variety of technologies at Eleanor Health including Google Cloud Platform, Mode, dbt, Salesforce, Callrail, Rudderstack, and Google Analytics.

Candidate Responsibilities

Proactively developing insights to help move needle and communicating the "So What?" and "What Now?" to the colleagues with all levels of familiarity with data
Access data provided by the Data Engineering and Analytics Engineering team to develop reports and analyses pertaining to marketing for key members of the Access and Engagement teams.
Build collaborative partnerships with stakeholders to find opportunities for data insights to improve performance
Create dashboards for the Access & Engagement teams following the principles of "Data Product" development
Develop board reporting on Access & Engagement performance for Eleanor Health Board

Candidate Qualifications:

Have 5-7 years of analytics experience primarily in healthcare marketing
SQL Expert with dimensional modeling familiarity
Ability to take an ask from a stakeholder and find the underlying business need
Have a keen eye for spotting patterns in stakeholder asks that can be automated by Analytics Engineering team
Highly collaborative individual who can become a relied upon member of both the Analytics team and Engagement team
Are keen on staying up to date on current technology trends and continuously improving team and company performance by incorporating modern engineering and best practices.
Value and display a high level of empathy and humility as well as personal accountability and ownership for meeting commitments.
Have strong written and verbal communication skills.
Are excited to work with a fully remote team.
Are currently authorized to work for any US employer without visa sponsorship.
The ability to complete all other responsibilities as required

Preferred:

Have previous experience with Salesforce Health Cloud and/or Salesforce Marketing Cloud and/or Salesforce Marketing Cloud Datorama and/or an EMR (electronic medical records)
Data analysis with Python experience
Familiarity with how dbt works and how to utilize dbt documents
Previous experience wireframing dashboards for stakeholder feedback

About Eleanor Health

Eleanor Health is the first outpatient addiction and mental health provider delivering convenient and comprehensive care through a value-based payment structure. Committed to health and wellbeing without judgment, Eleanor Health is focused on delivering whole-person, comprehensive care to transform the quality, delivery, and accessibility of care for people affected by addiction.

To date, Eleanor Health operates multiple clinics and a fully virtual model statewide across Louisiana, Massachusetts, New Jersey, North Carolina, Ohio, Texas, Florida, and Washington, delivering care through population and value-based partnerships with Medicare, Medicaid, and employers.

If you are passionate about providing high quality, evidence based care for individuals with substance use disorder through an innovative practice and about building a great business that makes a difference, Eleanor Health is an ideal opportunity for you. We seek highly skilled, motivated and compassionate individuals who take responsibility and adapt quickly to change to join our deeply committed and collaborative team.

The Executive Office of Labor and Workforce Development (EOLWD) is responsible for seven agencies and departments under this organization. EOLWD and its agencies are committed to developing a world-class, highly skilled labor force to support business growth and innovation in the Commonwealth.

EOLWD is seeking to hire a Data and Reporting Business Analyst who will be responsible for providing business architecture oversight and ensure technical solutions align with EOL business operational and strategic goals. This position will work closely with the Executive Office of Labor (EOL) Director, Reporting and Data Analytics to identify and prioritize all technical changes to the Enterprise Data Management (EDM) project. The Business Architect will act as a high level business lead to determine design choices and standards for technical changes that impact EOL.

This role will actively document and maintain business process models to serve as the foundation for developing business solutions. The Data and Reporting Business Analyst will work with EOL IT, business owners and vendors to manage resource allocations to ensure timely delivery of EDM development efforts. The Data and Reporting Business Analyst will collaborate with business and technical units to develop current and long-range plans to deliver innovative solutions and excellent customer service to the citizens of the Commonwealth. They will adhere to all EOL and Executive Office of Technology Service and Security (EOTSS) security standards and directives. This position may occasionally require working extra hours and being on standby status.

The primary work location for this role will be at 100 Cambridge St., Boston, Massachusetts 02114. The work schedule for this position is Monday thru Friday, 9:00AM to 5:00PM. This position would be expected to follow a hybrid model of reporting to work that combines in-office workdays and work from home days as needed.




Responsibilities:

Document business architecture models and business service definitions for EOL Business Owners, Subject Matter Experts, internal and external business partners as well as cross-functional and cross-organizational governance teams to provide enterprise assessments and recommendations
Plan and manage the daily business operations of the EDM Support Team by defining priority and resource allocation plans.
Serve as the business lead and perform project analysis to develop cost and time estimates, develop problem resolutions and assist with creating system and User Acceptance test plans for complex applications.
Develop and prioritize a list of EDM changes to align with EOL goals, objectives and key performance indicators. Adjust priorities as needed to meet legislative and policy mandates.
Document constraints within EOL business practices and workflows to identify business process re-engineering opportunities to align these business practices to the EOL strategies and business plans
Lead EDM operational business process and service definition sessions to support application design and software development efforts including:
Create comprehensive business process models and prototypes
Evaluate potential benefits and risks in proposed solutions
Analyze requirements/specifications and application configuration
Develop Six Sigma SIPOC diagrams to summarize inputs and outputs of proposed business services
Hold/ensure cross-department business process reviews for new business solutions
Improve business operational efficiencies by working with Operations Management, business users, Business Support Unit, EOL IT and vendors to design and implement changes, enhancements, and corrections to EOL computer applications.
Define testing objectives, approach, and timelines for EDM system changes and updates.
Create and document test scenarios for manual and automated testing
Assign and define testing roles and responsibilities
Document and execute test scenarios for EOL business areas
Identify key milestones
Adhere to issue reporting and resolution process
Test and analyze interfaces, functionality, systems, business requirements, and ad hoc testing to ensure the full and correct linkage and integrity of data and functionality between EDM and external systems.
Serve as a point lead for Business Analysts, Subject Matter Experts and IT Architects to provide clear guidance around business process and service definitions and principles.
Ensure quality assurance procedures and processes are understood and followed by the EDM Support Team.
Ensure that all projects conform to PCI, PII, ADA, records retention and security policies by working closely with various groups, e.g. Security and IT Operations.
Collaborate with the EOL Training department to prepare training programs and materials to support the necessary education of internal and external business application users.
Assign resources for the definition, configuration, development, testing and implementation of new business services
Train and mentor team members on business architecture practices and standards.
Ensures that employees understand and follow applicable policies
Manages personnel activities of staff such as EPRS, supervision, and professional development
Facilitate communication upward and across project teams including project status, cost information, justification for variances and business architecture implications.
Support the ongoing effort of data cleansing to ensure a high level of data integrity for EOL business applications, including:
Provide guidance in the merge process of duplicate records
Participate in data stewardship to govern data management issues
Design business solutions for EDM data requests using ad hoc reporting and data cubes
Participate in internal and external audit compliance efforts such as the Social Security Administration, Internal Revenue Service, and other Compliance Reviews.
Stays informed of EOL and EOTSS security policies and ongoing changes and updates.
Evaluate vendor software solutions and alternatives for Request for Response (RFR) and Request for Quote (RFQ) initiatives and respond to vendor questions related to business services.
Conduct research on emerging technologies and best practices in support of business operations.



Required Experience:

Two (2) to four (4) plus years of experience in a similar business analyst role.
Two (2) to four (4) plus years of experience writing and carrying out user acceptance testing.
Two (2) to four (4) plus years of experience documenting business processes and interfacing with various business units.
Two (2) plus years of change control management.
Business Intelligence (BI) knowledge; ideally one (1) to two (2) years of exposure to BI from an ETL perspective.
Ability to observe steps and ascertain success of step or failure and root cause of step(s).
Experience in Data Management.
Experience in Application Lifestyle Management.
Proven track record of self-starting and growth in related field(s).

Preferred Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:

Experience with Informatica SSIS, CDATA, other ETL tools is a plus.
Experience with interactive reporting platforms (Power BI, Tableau, etc.).
Experience with source control, continuous integration experience is a plus.
Proven success with documentation of processes, distributing to end-users and supporting those users.

Education and Certifications:

Bachelor’s Degree in computer science, Information Systems, Business Administration or other related field, or equivalent work experience.

Current Job Title:

Quality Systems Analyst

Location:

Clinton, Massachusetts

Position Summary:

The Quality System Analyst is responsible for preparing technical reports for customers. Facilitate management review and associated metrics preparation. This key role must ensure effective interaction with customer representatives and other internal departments regarding product report and metrics preparation. Ensures complete compliance to all applicable statutory and regulatory standards including cGMP/QSR, ISO 13485 and 21 CFR 820, Part 11. The analyst will use site and system data to produce trend reports which identify systemic issues requiring site corrective or preventative actions. This data will support the Management Review process and the ongoing identification of risk mitigation and continual improvement opportunities.

Key Responsibilities and End Results: (Essential responsibilities include but are not limited to the following):

Develop, prepare and review required customer documentation such as Quality Agreements, Customer specs, SOPs, Change authorizations in accordance with internal and external company policy.
Collect KPI and key process metric data and prepare slide decks weekly, monthly, and annually required for management reviews.
Provide support to Clinton/Devens Production and Project Engineering teams regarding quality issues, measurement data and measurement techniques, statistical methods and analysis, specification interpretation and application.
Ensure that the molding, assembly, and documentation of medical devices complies with cGMP regulations, including 21 CFR Part 820, 21 CFR Part 210, 21 CFR Part 211 and other international regulatory standards. Includes documentation (Device History Record and Device Master Record), validation protocols (IQ, OQ, PQ), and risk assessment (FMEA).
Participates as needed in the development, maintenance, and site compliance of product Quality Plans (QP) (Assembly and/or Molding), Standard Operating Procedures, Inspection Plans (IP), Batch History Record (BHR), Device Master Record (DMR), etc.… as established through local site and customer requirements.
Participates in commercial support problem solving activities including resolution of area non-conforming product/process events, process change/deviation authorizations, product quarantine events and complaint investigations, etc.…
As appropriate, may be required to directly interface with customers, suppliers, and other local site departmental resources at all levels of these organizations. Communication may include, but is not limited to, complaint investigations, CCN reporting, etc.…
Analysis of site QMS data to support Management Review process. Perform trend analysis on key quality metrics.
Identify quality system issues and recommend / implement corrective and preventative actions.
Ability to process CA or PA from audit findings and track issues to closure.
Track progress of follow-up items from External & Internal audit reports, Management Review, Corrective/Preventive Action Requests (8D) and other continuous improvement projects
Maintain Quality 1st mentality within the organization
May perform other duties and responsibilities as assigned.

Job Specifications: The minimum education and experience required to perform this job competently.

BS in a technical or applied science discipline (or equivalent Quality/ Process/ experience), with 3-5 years’ experience.
Experience in Quality Management Systems (QMS) and functions: Corrective Action and Preventive Action (CAPA), SPC-Metrics preparation and analysis, Material Review Board (MRB), Non-Conforming Material Reports (NCMR), Complaints, Internal and External Audits.
Experience in industry regulated under standards such as cGMP/QSR, ISO 13485 and 21 CFR 820, Part 11.
Strong analytical skills that include trending and evaluation of data with the ability to identify potential process problems, risks and opportunities for improvement.
Excellent computer skills including experience with Word Processing
Excellent report and presentation preparation skills utilizing MS office or similar tools
Ability to analyze data, drive root cause using analytical and/or statistical tools
Ability to correlate QMS performance with product and process quality trends
Desire to continually improve the efficiency and effectiveness of the QMS
Understanding of quality system regulatory requirements and how they relate to the business
Organized self-starter and pro-active approach combined with excellent time-management skills
Results oriented, with the ability to interact with technical and non-technical personnel
Strong team player with the ability to communicate at all levels, horizontally and vertically, throughout Jabil

The following are not required but are considered valued skills in job candidates:

Experience with Minitab, Lotus Notes, NWQS, SAP, Predisys SPC and Adobe Write applications
Experience working in an ISO 14644 Class 8 cleanroom work environment
Certified Internal/ Lead Auditor in ISO 13485:2016
ASQ certifications such as Certified Quality Manager (CQM), Certified Quality Auditor (CQA) or Certified Quality Engineer (CQE)
Lean certifications such as Six Sigma Green Belt (SSGB) or Six Sigma Black Belt (CCBB)
